content: Dear Bitcointalk users,I would like to introduce you to a new website I am writing since the beginning of 2023. I have had this idea for a long time and the new year got me really motivated to start writing this website.Skills to Mills is a digital platform that was established in January 2023 and is dedicated to teaching you why and how to invest your money in order to gain financial freedom.We will offer a wide variety of high-quality content about finance: the stock market, fiat currencies, cryptocurrencies, staking, margin trading, futures, etc.We will be writing specific blog articles about companies like Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, but also about our favorite cryptocurrencies and suggested trading methods.Visit our website here: https://skillstomills.comVisit our Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/skillstomillsVisit our Twitter page: https://twitter.com/skillstomillsWe hope to see you around in our daily growing community! Thanks a lot for you time!Kind regards,Skills to Mills

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: To begin with, I can say that your project is not something new or unique, so you will have to invest a lot of time, knowledge and money to make it stand out from other similar projects. I read the part where you write about cryptocurrencies in general and I can say that I do not agree with some statements or that they are somewhat confusing.QuoteFiat currencies are being printed at will, and cryptocurrencies have a capped (limited) supply.It's true that Bitcoin and some altcoins have a max supply, but some popular alts don't have it or at the moment that amount is still undefined. One of perhaps the most famous alts that recently moved to POS also does not have a clearly defined max supply, which in my opinion does not make it much different from fiat that is printed as needed.QuoteThere have been huge cryptocurrency scams in the past, especially when they were still very young. The expert cryptocurrency developers are learning every single day from these happenings, and will develop them in such a way that it becomes absolutely impossible to rig them.When you talk about scams, it would be good to distinguish those that result from poorly designed projects that enable their owners to carry out some scam to the detriment of their investors, from those that have nothing to do with it but are the result of ordinary people who take advantage of the greed and naivety of other people with the goal to make a financial profit at the expense of all these people. If we look at the past, one of the most dramatic events was the hacking of Mt.Gox, but also a few months ago we had a huge scam with the Korean so-called stablecoin and the US crypto exchange.In my opinion, it's hard to give useful financial advice if you don't understand some fairly basic things, but every beginning is difficult and no one is born smart, so don't get discouraged, but try to be better in the future.

comments.author: Skills to Mills
comments.body: Hey Lucius thanks a lot for your reply and feedback!You are right about that, and I will slightly change the text about cryptocurrencies having a limited supply. This is indeed not always the case.I want to make my website as unique as possible by writing about a wide variety of subjects, instead of just cryptocurrencies for example. Although cryptocurrencies are my favorite subject and what I have invested in the most.I'm going to learn more about margin trading and futures contracts, as I'm not so experienced in these fields yet.I will keep writing regularly and I'm absolutely sure that this website will be successful in the future.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I read through the introduction of the webpage and also checked a few other section and I'm quite impressed with the web structure and also the designs, I like the fact it's not painted with too much colors. But I do have one major concern about your webpage. We all know that most blogging site today that provide us with investment updates are now been paid to post articles so majority of them don't even take their time to investigate a project before releasing an article for them. So my question now is;  I hope "skills to mills" is not going to take that same path." at least you should do some research before you publish an article so as to reduce the risk of your audience being caught up in a Ponzi scheme just because of your publication. That's just my concern. Like I said previously the webpage structure and it's design are superb.

comments.author: Skills to Mills
comments.body: Hey Cantsay thanks so much for your reply!In order to generate some income I am using referral links throughout my website, especially to cryptocurrency exchanges. I have 7 years experience in the cryptocurrency markets and have both made and lost a lot of money myself.One thing that I promise is that I do not write about something which I have not personally tested myself. My intention is never to make money on the cost of someone else, so to say. If I recommend someone to buy something, I am almost sure that the reader will make money on it.The current cryptocurrency prices are really good for example, so anyone buying at this point and holding on to their investment for a long time, will definitely make a lot of money at this point.Any feedback is always welcome, you can reach me in multiple ways, also on social media.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on January 14, 2023, 05:53:24 PM I hope "skills to mills" is not going to take that same path." I think the website is just starting and the advise should be one step at a time, Op needs to attract more traffics before getting lobbied to write on projects that may not be good for his audience. Having said that, which he claimed not to be a part of such practice. I'd say that Op should work with high DA sites on the cryptocurrency niche for guest posts and building back links. It's a long process, but it'll pay off on the long run considering the number of cryptocurrency blogs that shuts down on daily basis. Staying in the market, OP, is your greatest weapon, and even if you don't want to run the site again, it can be sold for a good amount. In addition, I love the simplicity and the speed of the webpages they are good and it'll help readers to stay longer on your site which will help the ranking of the pages. Keep it up and don't stop.
